Satire Flag: [u'Province commits to releasing all past and present SIU reports as recommended in police reviewOntario will publish the details of every police-involved fatality dating back to 1990 \u2014 when the Special Investigations Unit was established \u2014 following a major report into police oversight in the province.\r \rAttorney General Yasir Naqvi made that commitment and agreed to immediately implement four other recommendations from Justice Michael Tulloch\'s report about Ontario\'s three police watchdogs. \r\rNaqvi said reports from 2005 to present-day will be available by December 2017 and reports dating back to 1990 to 2004 will be available by summer 2018, unless the family objects.\r\rThe report also recommended the oversight agencies begin collecting demographic data including race and religion, and release detailed reports any time an officer is cleared of wrongdoing. However, police officers involved in deaths or serious incidents will not be identified unless they\'re charged.\r\rTulloch released his government-commissioned review of the three bodies \u2014 the Special Investigations Unit (SIU), the Officer of the Independent Police Review Director (OIPRD) and the Ontario Civilian Police Commission (OCPC) \u2014 that oversee policing in the province on Thursday.\r\rOnt Police Oversight Review\rJustice Michael Tulloch released his recommendations on how to enhance oversight of policing in the province. (Frank Gunn/Canadian Press)\rTulloch launched the report after demonstrators blasted the oversight process. The report contains 129 recommendations to make police watchdogs more transparent and accountable.\r\r"I\'ve seen a great appetite for change in the province," Tulloch told a crowd of several hundred who gathered at a downtown Toronto hotel to hear the recommendations. \r\rThe recommendations include changes for the SIU, which probes all cases of serious injury, death or allegations of sexual assault involving police. The SIU should:\r\rRelease director\'s reports of all cases where officers are cleared, including all past reports involving death. This should include a clear narrative of what happened, as well as a summary of witness statements and any photo, audio or video evidence collected.\rEnsure at least half of the non-forensic investigators on any given investigation have no police background.\rRecruit more civilian investigators and give them anti-bias training.\rInvestigate any time an officer fires a weapon at someone.\r']

Satire Flag: [u'Ontario fire safety bill named after 2 firefighters who died in roof collapseAn Ontario private member\'s bill named after two firefighters killed in a roof collapse aims to protect others venturing into similar situations, by removing some of the dangerous unknowns.\r\rFuneral for 2 firefighters draws thousands\rVolunteer North Perth firefighters Ken Rea and Ray Walter died in 2011 when fighting a fire at a dollar store in Listowel, Ont. They were unaware that the roof was made with lightweight construction material that becomes volatile in a fire.\r\rProgressive Conservative MPP Randy Pettapiece\'s bill would ensure commercial, industrial and multi-family dwellings with that type of construction are identified as such with an emblem displayed prominently on the building.\r\r\'A heartbreaking chapter\'\r\r"The bill recalls a heartbreaking chapter in the history of our area," said Pettapiece, who represents Perth-Wellington. The city of Stratford and various townships in Pettapiece\'s riding are already using the emblems, he said.\r\r"To minimize the risk we have to maximize information," Pettapiece said. "This issue is important enough to warrant a provincewide solution, not just a patchwork of local bylaws."\r\rNorth Perth Fire Chief Ed Smith said lightweight and truss type construction are becoming quite popular and aren\'t a problem until there is a fire.\r\r"I\'m not condemning the type of construction," he said. "It\'s what we have to learn to deal with, but the issue is, we need something to help identify the particular buildings so we know we\'re dealing with that type of structure."\r\rWatchPoster of video clipFallen firefighters honoured\r\r\r\r JUMP TO BEGINNING OF THE TRACK  WATCH  ADJUST VOLUME\r00:00 02:00  SHARE  FULLSCREEN\rFallen firefighters honoured2:00\rSigns would ID flammable roofs\r\rThe letter R would be at the centre of the emblem if that type of construction was used in a building\'s roof, an F if it was used in the floors and an FR if it\'s in both.\r\r"When we respond to these types of buildings, usually we\'re responding in the worst conditions," Smith said. "Decisions have to be made within seconds to minutes on what we\'re going to do and to be able to identify that right away is a major contributor to the safety of our firefighters."\r\rThe Ontario Association of Fire Chiefs passed a resolution in 2012 to petition the government to make it mandatory that all lightweight constructed buildings be indicated as such.\r\rThe bill is up for a second reading vote Thursday afternoon.']

Satire Flag: [u"Police find carfentanil in drugs seized north of TorontoPolice are warning the public after the deadly opioid carfentanil was found north of Toronto in York Region.\r\rYork regional police say officers were called to a gas station in Richmond Hill, Ont., on Jan. 28 to investigate a report of an injured woman in the washroom.\r\rToronto prepares for potential epidemic of fentanyl overdoses\rToronto Public Health's overdose action plan gives addict hope\rThey say officers seized a quantity of white powder, believed at the time to be fentanyl, but say testing by Health Canada has determined the powder contained carfentanil.\r\rCarfentanil, which is 100 times more powerful than fentanyl and 10,000 times more potent than morphine, is commonly used by veterinarians to tranquilize large animals.\r\rPolice say the woman has been charged with possession and did not suffer any serious injuries.\r\rThey say recreational drug users should be aware that carfentanil \u2014 which can be lethal in quantities as little as two milligrams \u2014 can be found mixed with other drugs."]

Satire Flag: [u"Oil pit in Scarborough fully engulfed, firefighters battle 5-alarm fireToronto Fire crews responded to a five-alarm blaze at an auto-wrecker's yard around 11:15 a.m. this morning, \r\rCaptain David Eckerman from Toronto Fire Services said the yard is in a large, remote area.  \r\rAccording to Eckerman, an oil pit at the back of the yard was fully engulfed and the fire spread to an adjacent office building. \r\rWatchPoster of video clipViewer footage of fire in Scarborough auto-wrecker's yard\rCBC News Toronto\r\r\r JUMP TO BEGINNING OF THE TRACK  WATCH  ADJUST VOLUME\r00:00 00:33  SHARE  FULLSCREEN\rViewer footage of fire in Scarborough auto-wrecker's yard0:32\rHe said the area around the fire was evacuated and there were no reported injuries. \r\rCN Rail was notified to stop service along a track nearby because of smoke in the area. \r\rThe auto-wrecker's yard is far away from fire hydrants so a relay pump had to be used to pump water from one hydrant to the other to reach the fire. \r\rView image on Twitter\rView image on Twitter\r Follow\r Toronto Fire Service \u2714 @Toronto_Fire\rTORONTO firefighters battle Standard Auto Wreckers fire 1216 Sewell's Rd Sc.\r1:13 PM - 6 Apr 2017\r  36 36 Retweets   20 20 likes\rFire crews set up a foam operation to allow the oil to cool.\r\rHowever, crews were concerned that heavy winds would affect their ability to lay the foam on top of the oil pit.\r\rToronto Fire asked for pumpers from Pickering, Markham and Richmond Hill to help contain the fire. \r\rSteeles Avenue remains closed from Staines Road to Sewells Road."]

(Photo: Getty Images)\rMelania Trump may not live in the White House, but she made a rare appearance Wednesday to welcome King Abdullah II and Queen Rania of Jordan.\r\rWearing an emerald-green long-sleeved dress with a black belt and black heels, Melania greeted the royal couple, alongside President Trump. Queen Rania, who is considered an international style icon and unofficial \u201cBalmain Army\u201d member, wore a calf-length black belted dress with a white neckline.\r\rThe couples met in the Oval Office to discuss the war in Syria and antiterrorism measures and afterward posed for photos, one of which caught heat on Twitter for its \u201cweird\u201d arrangement. Journalist Yashiar Ali tweeted a shot of the two men sitting in chairs, with their wives standing stiffly behind them.\r\r\rAfter the meeting, the president said of the chemical attack in Syria that killed 72 people, \u201cThese are very troubled times in the Middle East. And we see what happened just recently, yesterday in Syria. Horrible. Horrible thing. Unspeakable.\u201d\r\rMelania and Queen Rania then headed off to lunch, followed by a visit to Excel Academy Public Charter School, an all-girls institution, with Education Secretary Betsy DeVos. According to a story published by ABC News, the women engaged in a roundtable discussion with students, parents, and teachers, and visited a science class and an art class.\r\rEducation is an important topic for the queen, who serves as eminent advocate for UNICEF and as honorary chairperson for the United Nations Girls\u2019 Education Initiative. Back in January, first daughter Ivanka Trump also met with Queen Rania, to discuss issues related to women around the world.']

(Photo: Getty Images)\rMelania Trump may not live in the White House, but she made a rare appearance Wednesday to welcome King Abdullah II and Queen Rania of Jordan.\r\rWearing an emerald-green long-sleeved dress with a black belt and black heels, Melania greeted the royal couple, alongside President Trump. Queen Rania, who is considered an international style icon and unofficial \u201cBalmain Army\u201d member, wore a calf-length black belted dress with a white neckline.\r\rThe couples met in the Oval Office to discuss the war in Syria and antiterrorism measures and afterward posed for photos, one of which caught heat on Twitter for its \u201cweird\u201d arrangement. Journalist Yashiar Ali tweeted a shot of the two men sitting in chairs, with their wives standing stiffly behind them.\r\r\rAfter the meeting, the president said of the chemical attack in Syria that killed 72 people, \u201cThese are very troubled times in the Middle East. And we see what happened just recently, yesterday in Syria. Horrible. Horrible thing. Unspeakable.\u201d\r\rMelania and Queen Rania then headed off to lunch, followed by a visit to Excel Academy Public Charter School, an all-girls institution, with Education Secretary Betsy DeVos. According to a story published by ABC News, the women engaged in a roundtable discussion with students, parents, and teachers, and visited a science class and an art class.\r\rEducation is an important topic for the queen, who serves as eminent advocate for UNICEF and as honorary chairperson for the United Nations Girls\u2019 Education Initiative. Back in January, first daughter Ivanka Trump also met with Queen Rania, to discuss issues related to women around the world.']

Satire Flag: [u'London students off to France for Vimy Ridge ceremonyIt was a defining battle that helped shape Canada\u2019s identity and around 500 London students are heading to the frontlines were a century ago to relive the victory.\r\rThe Thames Valley District School Board and Vimy Legion Branch 145 will both be at the Canadian National Vimy Memorial Sunday, marking the 100th anniversary of the Battle of Vimy Ridge.\r\rStudents are set to visit the Juno Beach Centre and Dieppe Memorial and Sunday\u2019s ceremony to learn about the battle that left more than 10,000 Canadian soldiers dead or wounded.\r\r\rREAD MORE: Long lost diary of Edmonton soldier sheds light on Battle of Vimy Ridge\r\rMore than two dozen Lucas Secondary School Viking\u2019s, joined by a dozen Glencoe District Highschool students,  filled the school\u2019s parking lot \u2013 luggage in hand \u2013 Thursday afternoon to mark the start of their nine-day trip.\r\rGrade 10 student Will Leach is taking a break from the history books assigned to him to experience the victory first-hand.\r\r\u201c(Lucas) did teach us about the site\u2026They did primarily talk about Vimy as it was the founding of Canada,\u201d he said.\r\rHis mother Kesia Singh Leach, who joined the afternoon send-off, wishes she could travel back in time for her own high school ticket to history.\r\r\u201cI can\u2019t believe they offer trips like this. I think it\u2019s amazing,\u201d she said. \u201cIt\u2019s hard to learn history just out of books. So to actually go there and see the battlefields or the trenches\u2026it just brings it to life and gives it more meaning.\u201d\r\r\r\rBeyond the history, Lian Alqayem, another Grade 10 student, is anxious to practice her French, capping the tour in southern France before heading back to London next Saturday.\r\r\u201cI really like French and the French language and Vimy Ridge is also very important to Canadian history so I thought it would be really important to go and support Canadians,\u201d she said.']

Satire Flag: [u'Bashar Al-Assad Shares Laugh With Military Leaders Over Time He Once Wanted To Be A Doctor And Help People DAMASCUS\u2014During a meeting to review the body counts from his latest initiatives to retake rebel-held regions of the country, Syrian president Bashar al-Assad shared an extended laugh with his top military leaders on Thursday over the time in his life when he wanted to be a doctor and help people. \u201cOh man, can you even believe there was a period when I actually wanted to heal people, to help end their suffering?\u201d said Assad, pausing the discussion of chemical weapons deployments to recall his youthful dream of providing lifesaving medical assistance to the sick and injured between gasps of laughter. \u201cAnd it\u2019s not like it was just a brief phase or something. I spent over a decade training. I even went to London for postgraduate study. God, there was even a point where I seriously considered working to help children. That\u2019s so crazy.\u201d After more than a minute spent clutching his abdomen in boisterous laughter, a beaming Assad reportedly emitted a few final chuckles, wiped away a tear of glee from the corner of his eye, and authorized sarin gas attacks on several villages outside the city of Hama']

Satire Flag: [u'Rancid Accidentally Record \u2018Let\u2019s Go\u2019 AgainOAKLAND, Calif. \u2014 Venerable punk outfit Rancid inadvertently replicated their seminal 1993 release Let\u2019s Go while recording their upcoming ninth album, according to sources who heard advance copies of their latest work.\r\r\u201cWe really wanted to get back to our roots with this one,\u201d said guitarist and vocalist Tim Armstrong. \u201cWe wrote songs in our practice space the way we used to, and we even asked Brett Reed to come back and play drums again, like the old days. We\u2019re really excited with what we came up with. It has the exact same sound and feel as mid-\u201990s Rancid.\u201d\r\r\r\rExperts note this process has often been used by bands looking to recapture a sound of years gone by. However, Rancid\u2019s efforts yielded unintended results, with the band completely recreating every detail of their breakthrough 23-song release, seemingly unaware of the reproduction.\r\rBrett Gurewitz, Epitaph Records owner and longtime Rancid producer, was puzzled by the potential album when he was sent a test pressing to preview.\r\r\u201cListen to me: I\u2019m not joking,\u201d said Gurewitz. \u201cIt\u2019s the same. The exact same. \u2018Radio,\u2019 \u2018Salvation,\u2019 \u2018Sidekick\u2019 \u2014 they\u2019re all on there. The craziest thing is they said they wanna call it Let\u2019s Go. The art they want to use is even the same: the back cover is Matt and Brett sitting in a car, with Tim and Lars standing outside of it because their mohawks are too big \u2026 but they are all just a quarter century older now. It\u2019s so strange. It\u2019s still a great album, don\u2019t get me wrong. But how do you tell someone you\u2019ve known forever that they accidentally recorded the same thing they made 24 years ago?\u201d\r\rRelated:\rRoadie Swaps Out-of-Tune Tim Armstrong for Slightly More In-Tune Armstrong Mid-Song\rWe Ranked Every Rancid Album by Whether it is \u2018\u2026And Out Come The Wolves\u2019\rFriend\u2019s Recording Studio Up and Running as Long as Mom Isn\u2019t Home\rIn his feedback for the advanced copy, Gurewitz was able to convince the band of their inadvertent duplication.\r\r\u201cI didn\u2019t believe him at first,\u201d said bassist Matt Freeman. \u201cBut he played them both at once, and \u2026 I\u2019ll be damned. I thought this new one came together pretty quickly. I guess that\u2019s why.\u201d\r\rUltimately vowing to never repeat themselves, Rancid reportedly announced plans to scrap the new release. As of press time, the band returned to the studio to begin work on a new, self-titled album.']

Satire Flag: [u'First: Badger Buries Entire Cow in Shocking New VideoIn January 2016, Evan Buechley found one of his carcasses in Utah\'s Great Basin had disappeared.\r\rThe conservation biologist, who leaves animal corpses out in the desert and sets up cameras to record scavengers, figured a pack of coyotes had dragged the 50-pound calf away.\r\rBut after a short search yielded no sign of the carcass, Buechley downloaded the camera\u2019s images to see if he could find some clues.\r\rWhat he saw, no one had ever seen before.\r\rOver the course of five days, the photos reveal, a single American badger excavated tunnels beneath the calf carcass until the whole thing collapsed into a pit. The badger then covered the carcass completely and constructed a burrow beside it, inside which it feasted on beef for 11 straight days.\r\rLater investigation into the scientific literature revealed no one had ever recorded a badger entomb anything larger than a jackrabbit.\r\r"I was really shocked by the fact that these badgers could completely monopolize and dominate that food source,\u201d says Buechley, who published a study on the new behavior March 31 in the Western North American Naturalist with three colleagues from the University of Utah, including National Geographic Explorer \xc7a\u011fan \u015eekercio\u011flu.\r\r\u201cThis is an interesting niche, and it may be badgers are playing a more important role in the nutrient cycle than anybody knew.\u201d\r\rBUILT TO BURY\rFound throughout the United States, southern Canada, and northern Mexico, American badgers are known for creating underground food lockers called caches. Such stores keep food safe from competing scavengers and prevent decomposition, thanks to the earth\'s natural coolness.\r\rSimilarly, the corgi-size creatures, which are related to weasels and wolverines, have a number of adaptations that allow them to dig like nobody\u2019s business.\r\rFor starters, badgers have powerful, heavily muscled forelimbs and long rakes for claws, which allow them to rip through hard, compact dirt. Their heads are cone-shaped, perfect for a life spent scooting around in tunnels. The burrowers also sport a third eyelid, called a nictitating membrane, which helps keep dirt from getting in their eyes.\r\rBut for all their burying prowess, no one has ever seen a badger tuck away such a large carcass, not to mention one more than two times its weight.\r\rHOLY COW\rAs you might imagine, Buechley isn\u2019t the only one excited by the discovery.\r\r\u201cWell this just made my day!\u201d ecologist Jessie Quinn, who has studied badgers and now works for Sycamore Environmental Cons']

Satire Flag: [u'New Study Finds Staring Out From Balcony With Best Friends Strongest Indicator That This Your City, Your TimeNEW YORK\u2014According to a study published Tuesday by Columbia Business School, the act of gazing out at the skyline from the balcony of an upper-floor apartment alongside your best friends is the strongest indicator that this is your city, your time. \u201cThe data shows that letting your eyes drift over the glittering lights as the magnitude of it all sinks in is the clearest sign that this\u2014this moment right now\u2014is yours to make it happen,\u201d said lead researcher Mark Khalid, noting that leaning slightly over a railing while silently patting one of your buddies on the back strongly correlates with the fact that the city isn\u2019t gonna know what hit it. \u201cIn addition, some of the most compelling evidence that the world had better brace itself, because here you fucking come, was an incredible view of all those faraway skyscrapers on a perfect spring night with plenty of beer to go around.\u201d Khalid added that glancing up at the full moon while a jumbo jet banks gracefully over the river is, however, by far the most accurate predictor that nothing is going to stop you, nothing.']

Satire Flag: [u'A 130-Year-Old Fact About Dinosaurs Might Be WrongWhen I first read Matthew Baron\u2019s new dinosaur study, I actually gasped.\r\rFor most of my life, I\u2019ve believed that the dinosaurs fell into two major groups: the lizard-hipped saurischians, which included the meat-eating theropods like Tyrannosaurus and long-necked sauropodomorphs like Brontosaurus; and the bird-hipped ornithischians, which included horned species like Triceratops and armored ones like Stegosaurus. That\u2019s how dinosaurs have been divided since 1887. It\u2019s what I learned as a kid. It\u2019s what all the textbooks and museums have always said. And according to Baron, a Ph.D. student at the University of Cambridge, it\u2019s wrong.\r\rBy thoroughly comparing 74 early dinosaurs and their relatives, Baron has radically redrawn the two major branches of the dinosaur family tree. Defying 130 years of accepted dogma, he splits the saurischians apart, leaving the sauropods in one branch, and placing the theropods with the ornthischians on the other. Put it this way: This is like someone telling you that neither cats nor dogs are what you thought they were, and some of the animals you call \u201ccats\u201d are actually dogs.\r\u201cLuckily, most of what we\u2019ve pieced together about dinosaurs\u2014how they fed, breathed, moved, reproduced, grew up, and socialized\u2014will stand unchanged,\u201d says Lindsay Zanno from the North Carolina Museum of Natural Sciences, who was not involved in the study. Still, \u201cthese conclusions lead us to question the most basic structure of the entire dinosaur family tree, which we have used as the backbone of our research for over a century. If confirmed by independent studies, the changes will shake dinosaur paleontology to its core.\u201d\r\r\u201cYou guys are brave,\u201d I told Baron on the phone.\r\r\u201cOr stupid,\u201d he says, laughing, with a tinge of nervousness.\r\rIf Baron is right, how could such a well-established fact about dinosaurs turn out to be wrong?\r\rPartly, people may have been blinded by their preconceptions. The split between saurischians and ornithischians was first proposed in 1887 by British paleontologist Harry Seeley, who divided the groups based on the shape of their hips\u2014a seductively obvious difference. \u201cWhen you look at specimens, it\u2019s very quick and easy to say: that\u2019s a saurischian, that\u2019s an ornithischian, and never the two shall meet,\u201d says Baron. \u201cPeople then go into their studies with that mindset, and Seeley\u2019s idea has never been rigorously tested.\u201d\r\rThat\u2019s not to say that previous researchers did sloppy science. They worked with what they had.']

Satire Flag: [u"Maggie Wall's MemorialOutside of a small village of Dunning, nestled in the former parklands of Duncrub Castle, lies a monument. It\u2019s a collection of stones about 20 feet high, topped with a cross and decorated with gifts left by visitors\u2014pennies, feathers, shells, fluffy stuffed animals, and tiny tea candles. The stones bear the words in stark white lettering: \u201cMaggie Wall burnt here 1657 as a witch.\u201d\rScotland was home to nearly 3,800 people accused of witchcraft between 1500s and 1700s, the vast majority of whom were women. In the end, about 1,500 were murdered as a result of witch hunt acquisitions. However, mysteriously, there is no record of a woman named Maggie Wall being tried as a witch. What\u2019s more, there\u2019s no record of the monument itself until 1866, though a forest surrounding the monument called Maggie Walls Wood was documented as of 1829.\r\rSome claim that Maggie Wall did exist, her records simply didn\u2019t. Some locals theorize that a member of the Rollos, a powerful family that lived in Duncrub Castle, had an affair with Maggie Wall and built the monument out of guilt. Another theory is that Maggie was a part of a backlash against a group of officials trying to elect a new local minister. The group was attacked by a hoard of women, and some believe Maggie could have been singled out and punished.\r\rThe accepted theory is that this monument stands as a testament to all the witches murdered in Scotland during the witch hunts as no other such monument exists. Perhaps the name was taken from the surrounding wood to represent the countless and forgotten women who were killed. Occasionally a wreath is laid at the foot of the monument, serving as a reminder of the injustices suffered by the mysterious symbolic witch, Maggie Wall. "]

Satire Flag: [u'Francis Frith\u2019s Photos Take You Straight Back To 19th Century Egypt And The Holy LandBritish grocer-turned-photographer Francis Frith took up photography in the early 1850s, unaware that he would start developing his negatives in tombs, temples, and caves within a decade.\rIn 1856, Frith traveled to Egypt to photograph ancient monuments using a mobile wicker darkroom in the darkest spots he could find. This allowed him to achieve his striking photographic results in a land of overwhelming light and heat. This so-called collodion process had to be completed within 15 minutes as well, which added a layer of drama to the proceedings.\rFrancis Frith\'s resulting photographs received such wide acclaim that he returned to Palestine, Syria, and Egypt twice before 1860, traveling farther up the Nile than any shutterbug before him. His pioneer spirit in this regard was a valuable commodity in the mid-19th century West, when photographic "proof" of the Holy Land was in high demand.\rWhether it was the Holy Land or elsewhere, Frith believed that photographs could capture the essence of a space unlike any other medium. Photographs, Frith said, could achieve "far beyond anything that is in the power of the most accomplished artist to transfer to his canvas."\rFrith\'s success as a commercial photographer enabled him to establish F. Frith & Co., which specialized in postcards of Britain and the Middle East. After years of enduring "smothering little tents" to build his company and his legacy, Frith switched gears to a managerial role.\rHis new project involved photographing every notable and historic site in the United Kingdom, a project that required hiring additional photographers. Combined with his postcards of the Holy Land, Frith built a company that his family ran until 1971.\rThe gallery above is a digital alternative to flipping through these Victorian-era photos depicting a mix of Old Testament sites and Egyptian ruins in striking, sandy sepia tones.']

Satire Flag: [u'Bull sculptor accuses NYC of violating his rights with Fearless GirlThe sculptor of Wall Street\'s Charging Bull statue is accusing New York City of violating his legal rights by allowing the Fearless Girl statue to be installed facing the bronze beast, without his permission.\r\rAttorney Norman Siegel told The Associated Press that Arturo Di Modica will explain at a news conference Wednesday exactly how he\'s challenging city officials who issued a permit for the bronze girl to stay until February. Siegel said he\'s demanding that the city release documents showing what procedures were followed.\r\rArtist Kristen Visbal\'s figure was first placed on a traffic island near Wall Street on March 7, on the eve of International Women\'s Day, to make a point: There\'s a dearth of women on the boards of the largest U.S. corporations.\rThe 4-foot girl staring down the 11-foot bull with hands planted on her hips quickly became a tourist magnet, drawing global attention on social media while awakening the imaginations of live visitors who posed for pictures. In response to petitions with tens of thousands of signatures for the statue to stay longer, Mayor Bill de Blasio announced that the city permit was extended for nearly one year.\r\rDi Modica calls the statue an "advertising trick" created by two corporate giants \u2014 State Street Global Advisors, the Boston-based investment giant, and McCann, its New York advertising firm.\r\rThe Italian-born sculptor says the presence of Fearless Girl infringes on his own artistic copyright to the Charging Bull, by changing the creative dynamic to include the other bold presence.\r\rA spokeswoman for the mayor did not immediately respond to a request for comment.\rThere was a time when Charging Bull was in a position similar to the Fearless Girl \u2014 waiting for the city to allow the piece to stay.\r\rDi Modica had installed the massive bronze in front of the New York Stock Exchange after the 1987 stock market crash, without a permit in the middle of the night \u2014 as a symbol of America\'s financial resilience. The city eventually responded to the public clamouring for the artwork to be allowed to remain in the Financial District, steps from Wall Street.\r\rThe sculptor came to him about 10 days ago, said Siegel, the former director of the New York Civil Liberties Union handling the case with attorney Steven Hyman.\r\rA lawsuit has not been filed, said Siegel, who declined to say whether or when that might happen.']

Satire Flag: [u'Jeff Sessions Is Keeping Junk Science in America\'s CourtsMuch of the "forensic science" used to convict people of crimes in the United States turns out not to be science at all. After a number of scandals showed forensic techniques developed by prosecution experts to be either flawed or completely bogus, the Obama administration took steps toward comprehensive reforms to address the crisis of junk evidence and wrongful convictions. But this week, Attorney General Jeff Sessions announced he is suspending those efforts.\r\rRELATED\r \rWhy Lawyers Are Freaking Out About Jeff Sessions as AG\rTrump\'s pick to be America\'s top lawyer has a nasty civil rights track record\rIt\'s hard to overstate how bad the junk forensics problem is. Take microscopic hair analysis: The FBI found that 26 of its 28 such analysts overstated the likelihood of matches over a 20-year period. As of March 2015, the FBI had found erroneous testimony in 96 percent of the 268 cases it reviewed in which hair analysts testified against defendants. In 33 of those cases, the defendant received the death penalty \u2013 14 were executed or died in prison prior to the review. FBI Director James Comey also recommended governors order reviews of cases in which hair analysis was used to convict defendants, because the FBI trained hundreds of examiners in its faulty techniques, and those examiners testified in state cases.\r\rThen there\'s bite-mark analysis, which isn\'t scientifically valid, but has been used to convict 25 innocent people who have been exonerated and an unknown number who haven\u2019t. Forensic dentists can\'t even determine whether an injury is a human bite mark with any consistency, let alone whether a particular human inflicted it. \r\rAnd the FBI abandoned unreliable examinations of bullet lead meant to show crime-scene bullets matched other bullets owned by defendants only after providing such testimony in more than 2,500 cases, over a period of decades.\r\rEven when the science is sound, junk practitioners have botched simple blood tests and mixed up DNA samples; even fingerprint analysts have shockingly high error rates. \r\rIn 2013, the Department of Justice and the National Institute of Standards and Technology formed a commission to engage independent experts to improve the reliability of forensic evidence. Satire Flag: [u'University Of Nevada Renames Vito Corleone School Of Business Following Latest Accusations Against BenefactorENO, NV\u2014Saying any suggestion of criminal activity was incompatible with the school\u2019s values, the University of Nevada announced Tuesday that it will rename the Vito Corleone School of Business in the wake of accusations against the benefactor, the late Michael Corleone. \u201cWhile we will forever be grateful to the Corleone family for more than 60 years of generous support, we cannot allow our institution to remain in the shadow of these allegations,\u201d said University of Nevada president Marc Johnson, who acted in response to widespread community pressure following newly uncovered evidence that Corleone, heir to the Genco Pura Olive Oil fortune, was involved in money laundering, bribery of state officials, and the 1955 disappearance of Manhattan bookkeeper Carlo Rizzi. \u201cThis is indeed a sad day for the community as we must cut ties with a family that has provided so much for our university, including the recent expansion of Sonny Field and the continued funding of the Peter Clemenza Endowed Chair in Neuroscience. Satire Flag: [u'ResearchThe Social Media Lab is an internationally recognized interdisciplinary research laboratory at the Ted Rogers School of Management at Ryerson University in Toronto, Canada. The lab studies how social media is changing the ways in which people communicate and disseminate information and how these changes impact the social, economic and political structures of modern society. It was founded in 2010 at Dalhousie University and moved to Ryerson University in 2014. It is led by Dr. Anatoliy Gruzd, its current Director and Founder.\r\rOur expertise lies in studying online communities and social networks and developing new tools and methods for analyzing and visualizing social media data. The broad aims of our various research initiatives are to provide decision makers with additional knowledge and insights into the behaviors and relationships of online network members, and to understand how these interpersonal connections influence our personal choices and actions.']

Satire Flag: [u'Three key lessons from the Pope\'s surprise TED talk(CNN)For all the talk about Pope Francis\' techno-savvy -- and 10 million Twitter followers ain\'t bad for a 80-year-old churchman -- he doesn\'t seem sold on Silicon Valley\'s endless promises.\r\rAs he wrote in his 2016 encyclical, Laudato Si, all those tweets and selfies can add up to a big pile of "mental pollution" that distracts us from what is really important.\r"When media and the digital world become omnipresent, their influence can stop people from learning how to live wisely, to think deeply and to love generously," he wrote in the encyclical.\rIt\'s not surprising, then, that it took more than a year, and some persistent asking, to get the Pope to record a talk from Vatican City for TED\'s international conference in Vancouver on Tuesday evening.\r"In this complicated and often confusing world, Pope Francis has become possibly the only moral voice capable of reaching people across boundaries and providing clarity and a compelling message of hope," said Bruno Giussani, TED\'s international curator, who finally coaxed Francis into participating.\rThe theme of TED\'s conference was "The Future You," and Francis did what he does best, delivering a plainspoken sermon on the importance of interconnection and tenderness. Essentially, he told the academics and innovators, scientists and techies, there is no "you," without an "us."\rLike any good preacher (or Ted talker), Francis made his case with three key lessons.\rI am a rock (but no island)\rThe Pope said he liked the title of the TED conference, because it starts a conversation about the future. But, he said, our goals are only achievable if we work together.\r"Quite a few years of life have strengthened my conviction that each and everyone\'s existence is deeply tied to that of others," Francis said. "Life is not time merely passing by, life is about interactions."\rThe Pope said he often thinks about his grandparents, migrants from Italy who moved to Argentina, and how they would have fared in today\'s cutthroat world and "culture of waste."\r"I could have very well ended up among today\'s \'discarded\' people. And that\'s why I always ask myself, deep in my heart: \'Why them and not me?\'"\rYou say you want a revolution?\rA good preacher challenges his congregation, subtly criticizing the status quo, while urging Christians to get in line with the gospel.\rIn his TED talk, Pope Francis said scientific and technological innovation is fine, but not when it blinds us to the suffering of people sitting next to us on the subway.\r']

And waiting for everyone to leave doesn\u2019t work because [Chief Justice John] Roberts takes super long showers and always stays late.\u201d\r\r\u201cMaybe if I just run in and do a really quick rinse it won\u2019t be that bad,\u201d continued the 113th person to serve on the nation\u2019s highest court.\r\rGorsuch confirmed that none of his colleagues seem to share his reservations about appearing naked before one another, noting that Justice Clarence Thomas doesn\u2019t hesitate to tear off his perspiration-drenched robe and hop into one of the ice baths following a long day of legal deliberations. The newest and youngest member of the court added that he was especially caught off guard by 80-year-old Justice Anthony Kennedy\u2019s tendency to wander from locker to locker in the nude as he animatedly recounts and breaks down each of the day\u2019s key arguments.\r\rAccording to Gorsuch, Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg is known to bring six-packs of Budweiser into the shower following a big victory in a landmark case, which he said is a type of behavior he never observed while on the 10th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals back home in Colorado.\r\r\u201cThere\u2019s usually a lot of whooping and hollering after a verdict is handed down, and it can get a bit rowdy in there,\u201d said Gorsuch, who was assigned a rusted metal locker that has reportedly remained dented since a frustrated Warren Burger slammed his fist into its door after dissenting in the 5-4 ruling of F']
